The purpose emanates from Allah&#39;s perspective, while the need is entirely from our own. The word <span class="inlineArabic">رسول</span> is derived from the root <span class="inlineArabic">رَسَلَ</span>, meaning to transmit, correspond, or delegate. Thus, the divine message, the Book itself, comes from Allah, but it is delivered to us through these intermediaries, the messengers&mdash;<span class="inlineArabic">مرسلین</span>. After believing in Allah, His Book, and His angels, the next article of faith is belief in His messengers. When they deliver Allah&#39;s message to humanity, there are two possible responses: either acceptance (<span class="inlineArabic">ایمان</span>) or rejection (<span class="inlineArabic">کفر</span>).</p><p>The word <span class="inlineArabic">کفر</span> is often translated as &quot;... {"ActionId":"b63f9535-5674-4867-8f80-b4e26b8ac9de","ActionName":"/_Host","RequestId":"0HNFP8U2OUV66:00000001","RequestPath":"/host/control-panel/UD3F5P3A","ConnectionId":"0HNFP8U2OUV66"}

After believing in Allah, His Book, and His angels, the next article of faith is belief in His messengers. The purpose emanates from Allah&#39;s perspective, while the need is entirely from our own. The word <span class="inlineArabic">رسول</span> is derived from the root <span class="inlineArabic">رَسَلَ</span>, meaning to transmit, correspond, or delegate. Thus, the divine message, the Book itself, comes from Allah, but it is delivered to us through these intermediaries, the messengers&mdash;<span class="inlineArabic">مرسلین</span>. After believing in Allah, His Book, and His angels, the next article of faith is belief in His messengers. When they deliver Allah&#39;s message to humanity, there are two possible responses: either acceptance (<span class="inlineArabic">ایمان</span>) or rejection (<span class="inlineArabic">کفر</span>).</p><p>The word <span class="inlineArabic">کفر</span> is often translated as &quot;... {"ActionId":"5973c7b1-3a46-48f7-b6aa-fe9e6604d5d7","ActionName":"/_Host","RequestId":"0HNFP92D1ENRT:00000001","RequestPath":"/host/control-panel/UD3F5P3A","ConnectionId":"0HNFP92D1ENRT"}

The purpose emanates from Allah&#39;s perspective, while the need is entirely from our own. The word <span class="inlineArabic">رسول</span> is derived from the root <span class="inlineArabic">رَسَلَ</span>, meaning to transmit, correspond, or delegate. Thus, the divine message, the Book itself, comes from Allah, but it is delivered to us through these intermediaries, the messengers&mdash;<span class="inlineArabic">مرسلین</span>. After believing in Allah, His Book, and His angels, the next article of faith is belief in His messengers.
